fields.element_enum:
antepartum_haemorrhage, Antepartum haemorrhage

Baby is eligible (calc)

This baby is not eligible for the following reason(s):
    {babyenrol_inel_loc}{babyenrol_inel_inc}{babyenrol_inel_ga}{babyenrol_inel_weight}{babyenrol_inel_anom}{babyenrol_inel_surv}
No further data is required. Please remember reasons for not being included need to be recorded in the screening log.

Custom field to discern if this form is being viewed in the REDCap Mobile App
(Uses javascript injector module to set value to false)

This baby is not eligible as it meets one or more of the following conditions:
  • Not born in the labour ward/maternity theatre
  • Neither preterm (born at < 37 weeks' gestation) nor low-birth weight (LBW; birth weight < 2.5kg)
  • Born at < 24 weeks gestation (GA)
  • < 500g birthweight
  • Lethal congenital anomaly identified at time of delivery
  • No reasonable prospect of survival, according to the attending clinician
No further data is required. Please remember reasons for not being included need to be recorded in the screening log.

fields.element_label:
It appears the temperatures entered are out of order. Please correct this issue. For your convenience, here is a summary of the dates/times entered:
  1. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_1]
  2. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_2]
  3. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_3]
  4. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_4]
  5. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_5]
  6. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_6]
  7. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_7]
  8. Temperature date/time: [temp_datetime_8]
fields.branching_logic:
[temp_datetime_1] <> '' and
(
([temp_datetime_2] <> '' and ([temp_datetime_1] > [temp_datetime_2])) or
([temp_datetime_3] <> '' and ([temp_datetime_2] > [temp_datetime_3])) or
([temp_datetime_4] <> '' and ([temp_datetime_3] > [temp_datetime_4])) or
([temp_datetime_5] <> '' and ([temp_datetime_4] > [temp_datetime_5])) or
([temp_datetime_6] <> '' and ([temp_datetime_5] > [temp_datetime_6])) or
([temp_datetime_7] <> '' and ([temp_datetime_6] > [temp_datetime_7])) or
([temp_datetime_8] <> '' and ([temp_datetime_7] > [temp_datetime_8]))
)

Start Date: PHASE 1 (2 months) Baseline control phase for all facilities
Start Date: PHASE 2 (1 month) Early essential newborn care (EENC) training and roll-out for all facilities, followed by randomisation
Start Date: PHASE 3A (2 months) Continuation of EENC provision plus NEWS-HEAT care bundle training and roll-out
Start Date: PHASE 3B (3 months) EENC + NEWS-HEAT care bundle provision

Custom field to discern if this form is being viewed in the REDCap Mobile App
(Uses javascript injector module to set value to false)

BUG NOTIFICATION

If you've not updated the PHASE 3B start date, but are seeing a warning message below related to steps that have to be taken when/if updating the PHASE 3B start date from within the app, you can safely ignore it. There's a bug on the REDCap Mobile App causing this issue, but the team that develops the app are aware and are working on it.

IMPORTANT

If the PHASE 3B start date is updated, then the REDCap Mobile App's project setup and data will need to be updated as soon as possible.

Please ensure that a notification is sent to the site letting them know to do this ASAP, and direct them to the following page for further guidance/instructions: REDCap Mobile App Guidance

IMPORTANT

If the PHASE 3B start date is updated, then the REDCap Mobile App's project setup and data will need to be updated as soon as possible.

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date other than today, then please do the following steps when you are able:

  • Send the updated data to the server after saving this form.
  • First thing tomorrow, ensure that you do a Refresh of the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date to today's date, then please do the following steps as soon as possible:

  • Send the updated data to the server after saving this form.
  • Open this form on the web version of REDCap and click "Save as Complete".
  • Refresh the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App.

Please refer to the following page for further guidance/instructions: REDCap Mobile App Guidance

IMPORTANT

If the PHASE 3B start date is updated, then the REDCap Mobile App's project setup and data will need to be updated as soon as possible.

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date other than today, then please do the following steps when you are able:

  • Send the updated data to the server after saving this form.
  • First thing tomorrow, ensure that you do a Refresh of the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date to today's date, then please do the following steps as soon as possible:

  • Send the updated data to the server after saving this form.
  • Open this form on the web version of REDCap and click "Save as Complete".
  • Refresh the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App.

For further guidance/instructions, please refer to the "REDCap Mobile App Guidance" dashboard page on the web version of REDCap (or the exported PDF version of the dashboard page - which you can save for offline use by viewing the page and clicking "Export as PDF" in the top right corner).

[arm3_site_shortlabel] - Notification Email Addresses

This form can be utilized to define email addresses to include on notification emails that alert sites to update their REDCap Mobile App configuration in the event of, for instance:

  • The implementation phase start date of a site has been changed
  • The redcap project has been updated

You can define up to 10 email addresses to include. Please do utilize the description field to give details on who each email address belongs to for clarity. You can also toggle email addresses on or off temporarily, if desired.

Form Version

Site Notification Email

This form can be utilized to send emails to selected site(s). The email addresses that the email is sent to are pulled directly from each site's "Notification Email Addresses" form.

Using the fields below, specify the subject and content of your email. You can also add attachment(s). Once done, save this form as complete and use the button that appears at the bottom of the page to trigger sending the email.

Once the email has been sent at least once, the subject and content fields will no longer be editable, but you can resend the email by clicking the "Send Email" button at the bottom of the page again.
Loading, please wait... If the page takes longer than a few seconds to reload, please click "Save & Stay".
Current user's email address (When the email is sent, the current user's email address will be CC'd)
Current user's email address (When the email is sent, the current user's email address will be CC'd) - What is currently saved to the database

Site(s) to email Sites that have no email addresses listed on their respective site's "Notification Email Addresses" form will not be selectable. It may take a few seconds for this list to have the available checkboxes enabled.

fields.element_label:
IMPORTANT

It appears that either the senders' email (e.g. who is viewing this form now) or some of the email addresses for the selected site(s) have been updated since this email was last sent on [nemail_sent_date]. Please click save and stay to save the updated email(s) to the database before resending the email if you're intending to resend it.

IMPORTANT

It appears that some of the email addresses for sites have been updated since this email was last sent on [nemail_sent_date] and, as a result, no emails are defined on the list (this may happen if, for instance, you send an email to site 01 that has one email defined on the list, then remove it, and then return here to try and email that site again). If you are looking to resend this email, please make sure the email list for the site(s) intended to be emailed are up to date, and then click save and stay to save the updated email address list for these sites. Then, so long as some emails are defined for the selected site(s), you will be able to resend the email. Doing so without following these steps may result in an error.
Send Email Once you send the email, you cannot edit the contents any longer.
